messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re; 2226 -- Ned AGREES with Sandra AGAIN
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/12/02 4:00:18 AM Central Daylight Time, ... If the parents are abusing and neglectful, why on earth would homeschooling keep them safe? I
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/12/02 4:00:18 AM Central Daylight Time,
nedvare@... writes:


> Ned says:
>
> I agree. And so has (does) my state, CT, big. We read about abuse, injuries,
> neglect, yes - killing, almost every week, and this, even though we know
> that the agencies, just like the schools, do whatever they can to hide their
> dysfunctions. No one is punished, no one is blamed. Why? It's the state.
> Private agencies are closed when they do the same things. Charges are filed.
>
> Homeschool those kids. Keep them healthy, safe. Nobody else will.
>

If the parents are abusing and neglectful, why on earth would homeschooling
keep them safe? I would think that in this situation, school would keep them
safe. School certainly kept me safe. But what do I know?
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re; 2226 -- Ned AGREES with Sandra AGAIN
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ned says: I agree. And so has (does) my state, CT, big. We read about abuse, injuries, neglect, yes - killing,  almost every week, and this, even though we
messages.messageBody:
>
> Message: 10
> Date: Sat, 10 Aug 2002 13:19:04 EDT
> From: SandraDodd@...
> Subject: Re: Re: MA court case (was Re: 2219 Death from Religion)


> Florida has screwed some stuff up badly.
>
> Sandra
>

Ned says:

I agree. And so has (does) my state, CT, big. We read about abuse, injuries,
neglect, yes - killing, almost every week, and this, even though we know
that the agencies, just like the schools, do whatever they can to hide their
dysfunctions. No one is punished, no one is blamed. Why? It's the state.
Private agencies are closed when they do the same things. Charges are filed.

Homeschool those kids. Keep them healthy, safe. Nobody else will.
